Das Duschwasser lief durch die TÃ¼r ins Zimmer, es war nicht viel Wasser, aber stÃ¶rend war es trotzdem. Zumal man das Problem mit Silikon sofort lÃ¶sen kÃ¶nnte.
Der Zimmer Service hat nachts von 10-12 die Fluren geputzt und morgens ab 8:30 Uhr die Zimmer. Was eigentlich ja relativ gut ist, aber die haben morgens einen geweckt. review.comment_positive:
Having previously lived in Nha Trang for 11 years and no the area well I particularly wanted a good hotel close to the beach but not on Tran Phu Street [main beach road], and the location of this was as about as near perfection as you could get, its set 1 street back in a quieter cull-de sac yet still only 3 minutes from the beach. And because I booked a family suite which was ridiculously good I had uninterrupted sea view,
Not sure if they even offer breakfast and why would I, right outside the front entrance is Hans cafÃ© offering a fantastic menu at a quarter of the price on Main Street, I even dropped my laundry of there and within a few hours  all handed back spotlessly clean and folded at a really small cost.
I also have to mention the staff, Phuong and Ngan on reception, an absolute credit to the hotel, nothing was to much trouble for them and every day when you pass either would check if all ok.
review.comment_negative: Nothing not to like, just wish I could have stayed longer, I will certainly be going back.

review.comment_positive:
I don't usually write reviews unless it exceed my expectation. This is one of those. 
The rooms were large, Comfortable bed, good A/C, TV with English channels, refrigerator and nice bathroom with hot water, shower and a bathtub, 
The location can not be better. Many places to eat and some convenience stores just outside the Hotel. 
The Main Street is 100 meters away with many Restaurants for any budget, Pharmacy, money change, and variety of shopping stores.
The Beach is at about 5 minutes walk. 
Two large shopping malls are located at 800 meters away. Nice walk.
The Hotel offer taxi transfer to the airport both ways at the standard price and it is very convenient specially in the way home as the vehicle will be waiting for you without wasting time for flagging a cab on the street.
The best part of my experience was the staff. I booked 2 rooms for my family and an extra one for a friend. We arrive early in the morning and they only have one room available at that time but they allowed us to check in right away so we can leave all our baggage in that room.
During my 3 days stay I interacted with many times with different front desk employees and all of them were always smiling and ready to help with may numerous questions. GIANG, went an extra mile helping my group with tours reservations and suggesting the best Restaurants.
We have a great and happy  experience and I will not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to everyone.
Thank you Giang for your good work.

excellent location - beach & restaurants all in walking distance of few minutes. Our room was on the 12th floor so we had the most stunning view of the sea and having a bath tub as well as shower was great. Rooftop pool is a bonus on a hot day - didnâ€™t go in but sat on a lounger for couple of hours - go first half of the day if you want sun as itâ€™s in the shade PM. 
Staff was helpful, lovely lady Ngan has arranged bus for us and also Phuong was helpful during check out.

Bathroom smelled of drains when we arrived but no major issues once we started using shower and bath. Walls in the room have marks which could be washed off, some areas could benefit from little tlcâ€¦
Wi-Fi was poor when high occupation at the evening.

review.comment_positive:
Rooms in property have been renovated so theyâ€™re now quite modern, especially bathroom. 
Beds were comfy. 
Property location was okay, down the end of a side street. However as a female traveller this felt a little dodgy walking back to at night after all the surrounding shops / food places / massage parlours closed around 9:30-10pm and then the alleyway was super quiet and dark. 
Quite a few decent places to eat within a couple of minutes walk. 
Beach is just up and across the road (hopefully you have good weather).
review.comment_negative:
We were told we would have a room with a â€œbalconyâ€. However on arrival we realised the â€œbalconyâ€ was tiny and basically just a very small outdoor space covered by metal bars, facing directly onto an apartment from the building next door . We also had no windows to look outside which was a little claustrophobic. Iâ€™m sure some of the bigger rooms would have better outlooks / balconies. 

Neighbours were noisy, walls were thin so we could basically hear the people in the next room talking and they also had annoying kids that kept knocking the wall. 
Could also hear people in the opposite apartment in the other building when they were talking on their balcony, as the â€œbalconyâ€ door wasnâ€™t very soundproof, but neither were the actual rooms.

review.rating: Ok to stay for 1-2 nights but not great
review.room_type: Suite Junior Deluxe
review.comment_positive: The pool, spacious room (but we had a suite, dont know about normal rooms)
review.comment_negative:
The hotel is located on a very loud street, full of russians, full of annoying sellers of everything, spa shops which try to immediately drag you in. No local restaurants, everything very touristic. 
The hotel also has a list of everything in the room, including cups and pillow covers with a pricelist. So in case you take something, they will immediately charge you. That creates a strange vibe, not feeling like hospitality.
Breakfast is not included and costs 120k. 
Cups provided are just a joke. Its like: are you kidding me? If you put coffee in - there is no space for water! In these details you feel the hotel doesnt care about guests at all.
The staff is not professional, speaks very bad or no English, sometimes impolite. Also they dont have much knowledge about the city: they couldnt even tell us where is the bus station or the train station. Only when I insisted to search for it, they could find some information on the internet. Not cool!

review.rating: Good location but not the most relaxing stay
review.room_type: Suite CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
review.comment_positive:
The hotel is in a perfect location right next the beach and shops, restaurants etc. it couldnâ€™t have been a better location. 

The hotel itself is a little run down, the hallways etc feel like they need work doing but it was ok. We had the sea view king suit which was a really nice big, bright and airy room, with lovely views looking out to sea. The bed was big and comfortable, good air conditioning, fridge and smart tv with Netflix and YouTube. The bathroom was really nice with a big window looking out to sea, powerful hot shower and nice bath tub. I would definitely recommend spending a bit extra for a nicer room if you can. 

The pool was nice to look out to the sea and cool down from, the heat. 

Staff were friendly and smiley.
review.comment_negative:
Unfortunately there was work being done so we were woken up at 8am every morning to the most awful loud drilling noise that was on and off from them until 4pm. This meant it was impossible for us to have a lie in which was very frustrating as it was suppose to be a relaxing break for us. We also couldnâ€™t sit on out balcony as it was so noisy. We recorded the noise and asked staff if we could move rooms thinking it might have just been our room but they didnâ€™t have another room available. By their reaction it seemed we were not the only people to complain about the noise. They did say we could have a partial refund and go to a different hotel which is fair enough but a lot of hassle. I just wished there was some information about the work and noise being done before booking as itâ€™s really unfair on guests spending money for a relaxing holiday when the hotel knows there is disruptive maintenance. 

House keeping also comes very early at 8am sharp and you can hear them knock on every door on the floor and shout â€˜house keepingâ€™ very loudly. -  not relaxing at all.

review.comment_negative: I was given a room next to which, every day from 7 am to 5 pm, renovations were going on; right next to my window (which overlooked the stairs) they were demolishing the wall.  Itâ€™s impossible to even be in such a room, let alone live.  But that didn't stop the hotel from renting it to me.  All requests to change the room were ignored, even when I offered to pay extra.  The staff referred to the lack of rooms.  When I requested a check out with a refund, I was also denied a refund.  I contacted the booking support, they contacted the hotel, where they were promised that there would be no more noise, this turned out to be a lie and as a result, during the laziness of the flight, I could not sleep properly.

review.comment_negative: The coffee was cold each day at breakfast because only 1 hot plate worked. My hubby tried to swap the tea over but was told not to. I showed the girl at the desk it was cold, sticking my finger in the cup of coffee and she rambled at me with no interest. Told front desk and also no change. We just wanted a cup of hot coffee to start our day. Also omelet doesn't have any extras, just egg and no poached eggs.

review.comment_positive:
What I like? Hmmm! They are make up your room everyday and they gave you water, toiletries, new towel, new rug for the toilet and they clean your room.
One more I really like here. They have a promotion for breakfast. Because some of my relatives they stayed in different hotel and they doesn't have a breakfast and our hotel allowed them to come in for breakfast. 80kvnd per person. And the location near to every where. It's really good.
review.comment_negative:
You have to check your room first before you enter and check everything. If something missing you have to tell them or else you will pay it. And check all your towel if it's clean. Or what because if you didn't check and tell to them they will asked you to pay it even it's not your fault. Check everything before you settled in the room..
And I'm expecting our room have a view but no. And the room it's a bit small.

Good location, 5 minute walk to the beach.  Itâ€™s down an alley where not too many cars go so we had to walk a short distance from the main road.  Lots of restaurants in the area.  

We had a room with balcony but it was on the 6th floor so we couldnâ€™t see over the building between us and the ocean.  Request a higher floor. Breakfast was  ok - eggs to order available.  Bed was comfortable and room was clean.  Hotel was quiet at night.  Only warm water for shower on the first day, it was hot the second day, wifi worked well.  Good value for the rate we paid.
